DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator related whether or not a participant experiences the lymphoma symptom of fever.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the lymphoma symptom of fever.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas and Hodgkin's lymphomas. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Fever, also known as pyrexia, is the elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal, usually taken as 37.7 degrees C.  Most fevers are caused by infections and almost all infectious diseases cause fever. (Wikipedia):An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Unexplained, persistent fever
ReferenceDocuments.description: Unexplained, persistent fever > 38 degrees C (or > 100.4 degrees F) in the previous month
